login.title: Login
login.subtitle: Serverless Project Contribution Platform
login.feature2: ‚úÖ Zero Learning Cost, Download and Use
login.feature3: ‚úÖ Zero Barrier, Only GitHub Account Required

placeholders.accessToken: Enter your GitHub Personal Access Token

login.registerHelpTitle: How to Register a GitHub Account
login.registerHelpContent:
Step 1: Visit GitHub

Open your browser and go to https://github.com


Step 2: Click Sign Up

Click the Sign up button in the top right corner of GitHub homepage


Step 3: Fill Registration Info

‚Ä¢ Enter username
‚Ä¢ Enter email address
‚Ä¢ Set password
‚Ä¢ Verify you're not a robot


Step 4: Verify Email

Check your email and click the verification link sent by GitHub


Step 5: Complete Registration

After verification, you can start using your GitHub account!
login.tokenHelpTitle: How to Get GitHub Personal Access Token
login.tokenHelpContent:
Quick Token Access

Go directly to: https://github.com/settings/tokens


Generate Steps

‚Ä¢ Click Generate new token ‚Üí Generate new token (classic)
‚Ä¢ Fill Note: SPCP Application
‚Ä¢ Select Expiration: Recommend 'Never' (no expiration)
‚Ä¢ Important: Check ALL permission options (select all)
‚Ä¢ Click Generate token


Copy Token

‚Ä¢ Copy and save the token immediately (only shown once)
‚Ä¢ Paste the token into the Token field on login page


Note: Token is only shown once, please save it carefully!

auth.title: GitHub Authentication
auth.message: Please enter your GitHub Personal Access Token for authentication:
auth.instructions:
How to get it:
1. Visit https://github.com/settings/tokens
2. Click "Generate new token (classic)"
3. Select "public_repo" permission
4. Copy the generated token

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: SPCP (Serverless Project Contribution Platform) Usage Agreement
terms.importantNoticeContent: SPCP is a completely transparent serverless collaboration platform. All data is publicly stored in GitHub repositories. Please read this usage agreement carefully.
terms.transparencyPrincipleContent: SPCP follows a completely transparent design principle. All participants, participation processes, and benefits are publicly disclosed in plain text and fully traceable.

section1.title: 1. Platform Overview
section1.content1: SPCP (Serverless Project Contribution Platform) is a GitHub-based collaboration platform specifically designed for decentralized world building, content creation, and collaborative projects. The platform adopts a completely transparent design philosophy with all data publicly stored.
section1.content2: Important Note: SPCP itself does not provide any services. All services are provided by GitHub. We only provide a client application to help users better utilize GitHub's collaboration features.

section2.title: 2. Applicable Scenarios
section2.content1: Open source software development: code, documentation, design, and other public content
section2.content2: Knowledge sharing projects: tutorials, guides, encyclopedias, and other educational content
section2.content3: Creative collaboration projects: art, literature, music, and other creative content
section2.content4: Community building projects: event planning, community rules, and other public information
section2.content5: Academic research projects: papers, research data, and other academic content
section2.content6: World building projects: game settings, novel worldviews, and other creative content
section2.warningContent: The following types of projects are not suitable for SPCP:
section2.warning1: Commercial confidential projects: internal projects involving commercial secrets
section2.warning2: Personal privacy content: sensitive information involving personal privacy
section2.warning3: Confidential projects: projects requiring confidentiality agreements
section2.warning4: Internal management systems: enterprise internal management systems
section2.warning5: Medical health projects: projects involving personal health information
section2.warning6: Financial service projects: projects involving financial privacy

section3.title: 3. Platform Features
section3.content1: The SPCP client application provides the following features:
section3.feature1: GitHub-based version control and collaboration features
section3.feature2: File editing and management tools (supporting Markdown, text, images, etc.)
section3.feature3: Automatic branch management and submission review processes
section3.feature4: Point reward and contribution evaluation system
section3.feature5: Multi-platform support (desktop app, mobile app, web version)
section3.feature6: Zero-barrier participation design (no need to learn Git technology)
section3.feature7: Completely transparent data storage and operation records

section4.title: 4. User Responsibilities
section4.responsibility1: Protecting the security of their GitHub account
section4.responsibility2: Not sharing account information with others
section4.responsibility3: Promptly reporting any security vulnerabilities or unauthorized use
section4.responsibility4: Complying with GitHub's terms of service
section4.content2: Users are responsible for all content they create, edit, or submit, including:
section4.contentResponsibility1: Ensuring content does not infringe on others' intellectual property
section4.contentResponsibility2: Ensuring content complies with relevant laws and regulations
section4.contentResponsibility3: Not publishing illegal, harmful, threatening, defamatory, harassing, or inappropriate content
section4.contentResponsibility4: Understanding and agreeing that all content will be publicly stored and completely transparent
section4.transparencyResponsibility1: All operation records will be publicly stored
section4.transparencyResponsibility2: Personal contribution history is completely transparent
section4.transparencyResponsibility3: Point changes and reward records are publicly visible
section4.transparencyResponsibility4: Application and review processes are completely transparent

section5.title: 5. Usage Restrictions
section5.restriction1: Abuse or maliciously use the platform
section5.restriction2: Attempt to damage or interfere with normal platform operation
section5.restriction3: Use automated tools for inappropriate operations
section5.restriction5: Upload content involving privacy or confidentiality
section5.restriction6: Engage in any behavior that may harm platform transparency

section6.title: 6. Intellectual Property
section6.content1: Users retain all intellectual property rights to their created content. By using the SPCP platform, users grant us necessary licenses to provide and improve platform functionality. All content will be managed according to open source agreements.

section7.title: 7. Data Storage and Transparency
section7.content1: All data is stored in plain text in GitHub repositories, including:
section7.guarantee1: All data is completely public and viewable by anyone
section7.guarantee2: Every operation has complete records and audit trails
section7.guarantee3: All decision-making processes are completely transparent
section7.guarantee4: The point system is completely public and transparent

section8.title: 8. Service Dependencies
section8.content1: The SPCP platform depends on the following third-party services:
section8.dependency1: GitHub services: all data storage, version control, and collaboration features are provided by GitHub
section8.dependency2: Network connection: requires stable network connection to access GitHub
section8.dependency3: Browser support: web version requires modern browser support
section8.disclaimer: Disclaimer: We are not responsible for the availability, performance, or data loss of third-party services.

section9.title: 9. Platform Availability
section9.content1: We strive to maintain the availability of the SPCP client application, but do not guarantee that the application will not experience failures. The application may be temporarily unavailable due to the following reasons:

section10.title: 10. Disclaimer
section10.disclaimerContent: The SPCP client application is provided 'as is' without any express or implied warranties. We are not liable for any direct or indirect losses arising from the use of this application. Since data is completely publicly stored, users should assess privacy risks themselves.

section11.title: 11. Platform Changes
section11.content1: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or terminate the SPCP client application at any time. Major changes will be notified to users in advance. All change records will be publicly stored to ensure transparency.

section12.title: 12. Dispute Resolution
section12.content1: Disputes arising from the use of the SPCP platform should be resolved through friendly consultation. If consultation fails, disputes may be brought to a court of competent jurisdiction. All dispute resolution processes will remain transparent.

section13.title: 13. Terms Modification
section13.content1: We reserve the right to modify this usage agreement at any time. Modified agreements will be published on the platform, and continued use of the platform indicates acceptance of the modified agreement. All modification history will be publicly recorded.

section14.title: 14. Contact Information
section14.content1: If you have any questions about this usage agreement, please contact us through the following methods:
section14.noteContent: All communication records will be publicly stored to ensure transparency.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: SPCP (Serverless Project Contribution Platform) Privacy Protection Statement
privacy.importantNoticeContent: SPCP is a completely transparent serverless collaboration platform. This privacy policy explains how we handle your information and your privacy rights when using the platform.
privacy.transparencyPrincipleContent: SPCP follows a completely transparent design principle. All data is publicly stored in GitHub repositories, which means your information will be visible to everyone.

section1.title: 1. Information Processing
section1.content1: SPCP is a pure client application. We do not collect, store, or process any of your personal information. All data is processed locally on your device.
section1.content2: The application only processes the following data on your device:
section1.dataType1: Local cache: editing content, setting preferences, and other temporary data
section1.dataType2: GitHub data: public information obtained through GitHub API (not stored)
section1.dataType3: User operations: editing, saving, and other operation records (local only)
section1.importantNoteContent: The SPCP client does not send your personal information to any server. All data interacts directly with GitHub services through the GitHub API.

section2.title: 2. Data Flow
section2.content1: The data flow of the SPCP client application is as follows:
section2.flow1: User ‚Üí Local Device: editing content, setting preferences, and other data stored on your device
section2.flow2: Local Device ‚Üí GitHub: direct interaction with GitHub services through GitHub API
section2.flow3: GitHub ‚Üí Local Device: obtaining project data, user information, and other public information
section2.flow4: Us: we do not receive, store, or process any user data
section2.importantNoteContent: Due to SPCP's transparent design principle, the following information will be publicly stored:
section2.publicInfo1: Your contribution records and operation history
section2.noteContent: This information will be stored in plain text in GitHub repositories and can be viewed by anyone.

section3.title: 3. Data Storage
section3.content1: Data is stored in the following locations:
section3.location1: GitHub repositories: all project-related data, user information, operation records (managed by GitHub)
section3.location2: Your local device: temporary cache, setting preferences, editing drafts (controlled by you)
section3.location3: Our servers: none (we do not run any servers)
section3.control1: GitHub data: managed by GitHub's privacy policy and terms of service
section3.control2: Local data: completely controlled by you, can be deleted at any time
section3.control3: Us: we do not store any user data

section4.title: 4. Data Sharing
section4.subtitle1: 4.1 We Do Not Share Your Data
section4.content1: The SPCP client application does not share your data with any third parties because we do not collect, store, or process any user data.
section4.warningContent: Due to SPCP's transparent design, the following information will be publicly stored:
section4.publicData1: All project content and collaboration records (stored in GitHub repositories)
section4.publicData2: User contribution history and point records (stored in GitHub repositories)
section4.publicData3: Review processes and decision records (stored in GitHub repositories)
section4.noteContent: This data is managed by GitHub and subject to GitHub's privacy policy.

section5.title: 5. Data Security
section5.content1: Security measures of the SPCP client application:
section5.security1: Using HTTPS encryption to communicate with GitHub API
section5.security2: Local data stored on your device, controlled by you
section5.security4: Not sending sensitive information to any server
section5.warningContent: Due to transparent design principles, the following security limitations need attention:
section5.limitation1: Data in GitHub repositories is stored in plain text without encryption protection
section5.limitation2: Anyone can access and view public data
section5.limitation3: Complete data confidentiality cannot be guaranteed
section5.limitation4: It is recommended not to upload sensitive or confidential information

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
section6.right1: View your personal information and contribution records
section6.right2: Understand how data is used and stored
section6.right3: Obtain data copies and export functionality
section6.control1: Control account information through GitHub settings
section6.control2: Delete local cache and temporary data
section6.control3: Choose not to participate in certain features
section6.control4: Contact us to handle data-related issues
section6.warningContent: Due to transparent design principles, the following rights are limited:
section6.limitation1: Cannot delete already public contribution records
section6.limitation2: Cannot hide operation history and point records
section6.limitation4: All changes will be recorded and made public

section7.title: 7. Children's Privacy
section7.content1: SPCP is not specifically designed for children under 13. If you are a child under 13, please use this platform under the guidance of parents or guardians.

section8.title: 8. International Transfer
section8.content1: Your information may be transferred to other countries through GitHub services. We rely on GitHub's data protection measures to protect your information.

section9.title: 9. Privacy Policy Changes
section9.content1: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Major changes will be notified through the following methods:

section10.title: 10. Contact Us
section10.content1: If you have any questions or suggestions about this privacy policy, please contact us through the following methods:

section11.title: 11. Applicable Law
section11.content1: This privacy policy is governed by the laws of the People's Republic of China. If you are in the European Union, this policy also complies with GDPR regulations.
